overcome with excitement, so I thought
I'd explore a cave along the coast.

It's a terrifying place indeed.

from less formidable ones tend to be

女の恨みってのは怖いもんさ
陥れられた恨み、蔑まれた恨み――
そういうのがたっぷり詰まってるのが、遺跡なのさ
その傍で、恨みに塗れた女の魂が現れるって話だが
どこにもそんなのいやしねえ
column4:
A woman's grudge can be terrifying. 
The resentment from betrayal, 
the scorn felt— 
that's what's packed into the ruins. 
It's said that the souls of women, 
tainted by their hatred, manifest near them, 
but I doubt you'll find such a thing here.

火、氷、雷――相手が何で襲ってこようと
平気で戦える装備でなくちゃいけません
特にこんな、危険なフィンダム大陸ではね
いつも決まった攻撃をしかけてくるとは
限らないのだから――

Fire, ice, lightning— 
you need to be equipped to fight 
regardless of what the enemy attacks with. 
Especially in this dangerous 
land of Phindym. 
You can't assume they'll always 
use the same attacks.

少し前、グリンデュアがもっと安全で
村が鉱石の交易で潤ってた時に
よくあちこちから客人を迎えてる怪しい男がいた
災厄が起こってからは、しばらく見なかったけど
さっき久しぶりに見たんだが、やつれていたよ
column4:
There was a suspicious man not long ago 
who often welcomed guests when Glyndwr 
was safer and the village thrived on 
ore trading. Since the disaster, he 
hadn't been seen for a while, but 
I spotted him just now—he looked 
quite haggard.

column3:
イヴァノスの塔――なぜ彼らはあれほど
塔を守ろうとするの？
塔に特別なところをは見られないし――
本来、建物は中の人を守るためのもの
それが、なぜそんな解釈になったか気になるわね
column4:
Ivano's Tower—why do they 
protect it so fiercely? 
There doesn't seem to be anything special 
about the tower itself. Buildings are meant 
to protect those inside, so I'm curious 
why it's interpreted that way.
